reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 9373, 'name': 'Vlad Gusev', 'email': 'vlad.esten@gmail.com', 'username': 's10'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28935, 'name': '98k', 'email': '18552437190@163.com', 'username': '98k'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-05 15:37:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_status.py', 'nova/cmd/status.py'], 'message': 'Fix nova-status "_check_resource_providers" check

The way in which this check counted compute nodes was
broken because of an incorrect for/else condition. If
the check is run with a nova.conf like we have in
devstack, where the API database is configured but
the [database]/connection is pointing at cell0, where
there are no compute nodes, the check passes saying
there are no compute nodes even if the are compute
nodes found in the cell databases (in the for loop).
This is because the else executes because the for loop
doesn't break, and then _count_compute_nodes returns 0
for cell0 and overwrites the num_computes variable.

This fixes the issue by checking if we have cell mappings
before running the loop, else we hit the else block as
was originally intended.

Change-Id: I1a706d028a9ca894348a19b7b3df1ea673e4ec90
Partial-Bug: #1790721
(cherry picked from commit dcd421ae9e6f0391fea06c9d20949267354c3b3c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova-status "_check_resource_providers" check

The way in which this check counted compute nodes was
broken because of an incorrect for/else condition. If
the check is run with a nova.conf like we have in
devstack, where the API database is configured but
the [database]/connection is pointing at cell0, where
there are no compute nodes, the check passes saying
there are no compute nodes even if the are compute
nodes found in the cell databases (in the for loop).
This is because the else executes because the for loop
doesn't break, and then _count_compute_nodes returns 0
for cell0 and overwrites the num_computes variable.

This fixes the issue by checking if we have cell mappings
before running the loop, else we hit the else block as
was originally intended.

Change-Id: I1a706d028a9ca894348a19b7b3df1ea673e4ec90
Partial-Bug: #1790721
(cherry picked from commit dcd421ae9e6f0391fea06c9d20949267354c3b3c)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-09-17 10:21:05.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/neutron.pp', 'manifests/nova.pp'], 'message': 'Enable nova metadata via httpd wsgi

Support for nova metadata api via wsgi was added in dependency.
This changes so that we test with running via wsgi.

With nova metadata api running via wsgi it is ssl terminated, also
neutron metadata agent does not support an ipv6 address for the
metadata_host, so we need to configure the neutron metadata agent
to connect via https to the nova metadata api.

Related-Bug: 1781405

Depends-On: Ic65736cb0e95c400a728cd699ecf06c6aecff832
Depends-On: I3d572dda2e90b7e24f2f8912d704462b9332d807

Change-Id: I03f4dcb7f40055d802b114ee305323c95975e4df
'}]
commit_message:
Enable nova metadata via httpd wsgi

Support for nova metadata api via wsgi was added in dependency.
This changes so that we test with running via wsgi.

With nova metadata api running via wsgi it is ssl terminated, also
neutron metadata agent does not support an ipv6 address for the
metadata_host, so we need to configure the neutron metadata agent
to connect via https to the nova metadata api.

Related-Bug: 1781405

Depends-On: Ic65736cb0e95c400a728cd699ecf06c6aecff832
Depends-On: I3d572dda2e90b7e24f2f8912d704462b9332d807

Change-Id: I03f4dcb7f40055d802b114ee305323c95975e4df

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

(cherry picked from commit 024a35d700c922cdd2284063fcf6c8d1c4bb1c35)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-09-17 13:04:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/common/l3_test_common.py'], 'message': "Fix IPv6 prefix delegation issue on agent restart

On l3-agent restart, prefix delegation subnets weren't always
inserted into the local router_info cache, leading to a missing
ip6tables rule.  Add it when the internal network is configured
if the prefix has already been assigned.

Change-Id: Ic045e2763ba2772bcaf037591821501e84e40878
Closes-bug: #1789403
"}]
commit_message:
Fix IPv6 prefix delegation issue on agent restart

On l3-agent restart, prefix delegation subnets weren't always
inserted into the local router_info cache, leading to a missing
ip6tables rule.  Add it when the internal network is configured
if the prefix has already been assigned.

Change-Id: Ic045e2763ba2772bcaf037591821501e84e40878
Closes-bug: #1789403

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I28ff7b95d3b2cc064c59c9966e9c25c7ad9184da
(cherry picked from commit 939df557398f755b50116e0dad66032d4c2b1bb8)

2. Add server_boot_kwargs args for custom server boot, for example for

3. Add action to check server indexed.

commit_message:
Improve Elasticsearch scenario

1. Use NovaScenario parent for Elasticserch scenario and use
_boot_server method for creating server instead of client method.

2. Add server_boot_kwargs args for custom server boot, for example for
defining custom nic.

3. Add action to check server indexed.

4. Add variability flag - search elasticsearch by id or name.

5. Add additional_query arg for better and clarified query results.

Change-Id: Ic889def63bb6e8f535ac9e1aeed9b4f19e6f8823

commit_message:
Add manage_memcache_package parameter

Adds a new parameter named manage_memcache_package that
can be used to set if we should install the python memcache
library if memcache caching is enabled.

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
2. We rename the tox target for 'func_lxc' to 'lxc' and

Change-Id: Ie0e72f69026c44a3c3ff6316bbb308bdd873c149

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
2. We rename the tox target for 'func_lxc' to 'lxc' and
   as the 'func_' prefix is pointless.
3. We remove the base python setting in the lxc tox target
   because we're not running our functional tests using py3
   yet.

Change-Id: Ie0e72f69026c44a3c3ff6316bbb308bdd873c149

commit_message:
Ensure package cache is updated for nspawn containers

Due to differences in the way the containers are created, the
package cache must be forcefully updated after creation. If
this is not done then apt thinks that it's up to date and
fails package installs.

We also ensure that the quota is rescanned to ensure that
it is up to date.

The playbook arrangement is also updated to standardise to
the same pattern as the others.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593033
Change-Id: I44ea902b0785bdeec4565e926105d24fae18500f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:

checkout the SHA. Given that there is only one more commit in
the repo which is only to modify tests, we can use the latest
tag instead.

Adding support for using vSphere template as a volume
snapshot format in vCenter server. The current format
(COW disk) does not allow snapshot of attached volumes

format.

Change-Id: Id5dd71a785c4cd72ba44f9b4d26319be53079c39

commit_message:
VMware: Use vSphere template as snapshot format

Adding support for using vSphere template as a volume
snapshot format in vCenter server. The current format
(COW disk) does not allow snapshot of attached volumes
and this limitation is removed by the new template
format.

Change-Id: Id5dd71a785c4cd72ba44f9b4d26319be53079c39

commit_message:
file_perms: Skip rpm verification step for Leap 15

openSUSE Leap 15 has a bug in the sudo package and this test always
fails. As such, we need to skip it until the upstream bug is fixed.

Change-Id: Ifa6baa50d0e0c2e2cabba39ba101ef943f14d882
Link: https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1097643

Some cleanups:

  need for this setting - and the docs-pti template uses tox.ini
* Use lower-constraints template instead of individual jobs
* Use cover template to run cover job in check instead of post queue.
* Sort template list alphabetically.

Change-Id: I6b77786007070794601c0b7d6262a4c2db8fbe0c

commit_message:
Update .zuul.yaml

Some cleanups:
* Remove python3 variable from tox-docs, tox.ini is setup correctly; no
  need for this setting - and the docs-pti template uses tox.ini
* Use lower-constraints template instead of individual jobs
* Use cover template to run cover job in check instead of post queue.
* Sort template list alphabetically.

Change-Id: I6b77786007070794601c0b7d6262a4c2db8fbe0c

commit_message:
Expose the endpoint_override parameter

After the deprecation of the parameters "service_url" from
group "inspector" and "api_url" from group "conductor", we need
to expose the "endpoint_override" in groups "inspector" and
"service_catalog"

Change-Id: Iae5d8913f64665327024841c2af709bea3c25b49

subject: Remove tempest testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-20 02:08:34.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test.yml', 'tests/os_designate-overrides.yml'], 'message': 'Remove tempest testing

The stable/ocata branches are now in extended maintenance, so we
no longer expect to do releases from them. The tempest tests are
somewhat broken at this time, and this old code is difficult to
troubleshoot to fix it. As such, we remove the tempest tests,
leaving only a convergence test and rely on anyone still using
the old branch to resolve issues as they come up.

Change-Id: I0ae271d49ebe43bfcaeda82159ec03ad6a82accd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove tempest testing

The stable/ocata branches are now in extended maintenance, so we
no longer expect to do releases from them. The tempest tests are
somewhat broken at this time, and this old code is difficult to
troubleshoot to fix it. As such, we remove the tempest tests,
leaving only a convergence test and rely on anyone still using
the old branch to resolve issues as they come up.

Change-Id: I0ae271d49ebe43bfcaeda82159ec03ad6a82accd

not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With

   relics of the past.

Change-Id: I944a8163a34b51258a4f0da92cfcd6f046fd1961

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'func_base' and 'func_log'. They are unused
   relics of the past.

Change-Id: I944a8163a34b51258a4f0da92cfcd6f046fd1961
(cherry picked from commit 8b9b70845f27b86301a38736f502652bf4770394)

subject: Define cache_timeout variable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-20 09:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['vars/ubuntu.yml'], 'message': "Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ia788e5b83233e8f34377b024f98f7e463d85c1b7
"}]
commit_message:
Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ia788e5b83233e8f34377b024f98f7e463d85c1b7

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I309022aa53b8878a167d09d6288678eee5ca0159
(cherry picked from commit d47e318bc14043912b2a3f817b0afc1ab0e62202)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ida3b1bc70fbd6ab958d8669e925de1d3151f69ff
Story: #2002586
Task: #24342

ansible_ssh_host and ansible_host variable behave differently
when used with delegate_to keyword.

commit_message:
Use ansible_host variable in wait_for task.

ansible_ssh_host and ansible_host variable behave differently
when used with delegate_to keyword.
ansible_ssh_host uses value from delegate_to, while
ansible_host stays intact.

Change-Id: I3c80da359cdd1051ed590ca7e282a22a15647033

subject: Add bus for auto-loading charm modules.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-20 09:34:43.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_charms_openstack_bus.py', 'charms_openstack/bus.py'], 'message': 'Add bus for auto-loading charm modules.

charms_openstack.bus.discover() can now be used to load the openstack
charm modules placed under lib/charm/openstack/. This is particularly
useful when using the generic provide_charm_instance() code e.g.

```
charms_openstack.bus.discover()

with charms_openstack.charm.provide_charm_instance() as ci:
    ci.some_charm_instance_method()
```

Change-Id: Ic1dfb58a37b3f283bbc5b31b5ea192527fc8e57d
'}]
commit_message:
Add bus for auto-loading charm modules.

charms_openstack.bus.discover() can now be used to load the openstack
charm modules placed under lib/charm/openstack/. This is particularly
useful when using the generic provide_charm_instance() code e.g.

```
charms_openstack.bus.discover()

with charms_openstack.charm.provide_charm_instance() as ci:
    ci.some_charm_instance_method()
```

Change-Id: Ic1dfb58a37b3f283bbc5b31b5ea192527fc8e57d

commit_message:
Disable OVN related services in ODL env file

ODL and OVN services are mutually exclusive and
leads to deployment failure when enabled on a role.
This patch sets OVN services to OS::Heat::None in
ODL env file to disable it whenever ODL is enabled.

Change-Id: Iaa757339f24fbadf51152326fe62f194c25e2384

commit_message:
Refactor periodic "tips" jobs

Two changes:
1 - declare the abstract base tips jobs 'abstract'
2 - add a branch matcher to where the periodic tips jobs
    are invoked in the project definition so that they only
    apply to the master branch

Change-Id: I1093de2583da862f58372e6c03b2d9b604dbd630
(cherry picked from commit 11db636c346c2a5ffcdc9a33633844939d116352)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-19 02:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/haproxy.yaml', 'puppet/services/haproxy.yaml'], 'message': "Only set ca_bundle for HAProxy if internal TLS enabled & fix mounts

* We don't use this setup if TLS everywhere is not enabled, so lets set it
  up as such. This prevents the HAProxy container managed by pacemaker of
  mounting this file.
* Also fix the docker service to exercise the if with proper syntax.

Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id8dff81c5af390446507bcef458a135fc2287186
"}]
commit_message:
Only set ca_bundle for HAProxy if internal TLS enabled & fix mounts

* We don't use this setup if TLS everywhere is not enabled, so lets set it
  up as such. This prevents the HAProxy container managed by pacemaker of
  mounting this file.
* Also fix the docker service to exercise the if with proper syntax.

Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id8dff81c5af390446507bcef458a135fc2287186

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I5c33fb6da777e0861b633b78f4ebcaa6971ddbb3
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-14 14:45:07.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py', 'networking_ovn/common/utils.py', 'networking_ovn/common/constants.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/tests/unit/test_ovn_db_sync.py', 'networking_ovn/l3/l3_ovn.py'], 'message': 'Consolidate add/remove router interface OVS transactions

This patch consolidades the database transactions for creating/deleting
router ports on/from the OVN NB database. Having a single transaction is
ideal to avoid inconsistencies that can be cause between two or more
transactions.

Closes-Bug: #1756388
Change-Id: I0a0a5f6571ea695b91db89170be1fab258acd917
(cherry picked from commit 378f4ec58e16a363aeabd16da1911775d0b36487)
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate add/remove router interface OVS transactions

This patch consolidades the database transactions for creating/deleting
router ports on/from the OVN NB database. Having a single transaction is
ideal to avoid inconsistencies that can be cause between two or more
transactions.

Closes-Bug: #1756388
Change-Id: I0a0a5f6571ea695b91db89170be1fab258acd917
(cherry picked from commit 378f4ec58e16a363aeabd16da1911775d0b36487)

commit_message:
Remove logging overrides from plugin.sh

Avoid overwriting the log formatters, reuse
the helper available in Devstack.

Closes-Bug: #1787310

commit_message:
Add ha-guide to redirect ignore list

The openstack/ha-guide repo is being restored and maintained by the
Operations Documentation SIG. At least for now, this information will
not be cycle based and should not be redirected from its base URL to
/latest. This adds the repo to the list to be ignored for .htaccess
redirects.

Change-Id: I6ffb504c819c8087566763b1abef24b9db5237ed
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Ibecc182d370d1aa3801f49d47421d9fd2037df5f
(cherry picked from commit 9f4de30f2055ff5ae07513670c5ea7a1308794ad)

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2017-01-27 14:31:40.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': 'Run cell v2 setup differently for upgrades

For the upgrades from Newton, we need to run the cell v2 simple setup
before running the api db sync since we did not deploy cell v2 in
Newton. Starting with Ocata, api db sync errors if the cell v2 simple

Closes-Bug: #1649341

commit_message:
Run cell v2 setup differently for upgrades

For the upgrades from Newton, we need to run the cell v2 simple setup
before running the api db sync since we did not deploy cell v2 in
Newton. Starting with Ocata, api db sync errors if the cell v2 simple
setup has not been done.

Change-Id: I80ecc0943e08952fbc29c55da9d4ba8f51b0eb7e
Closes-Bug: #1649341

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2018-06-20 08:09:15.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/lib/services/volume/v3/types_client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rename-volume-type-extra-specs-apis-a20b8b2a31fb30ef.yaml', 'tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volume_types_extra_specs.py', 'tempest/api/volume/admin/test_volume_types_extra_specs_negative.py'], 'message': "Rename volume type extra specs APIs

The name of APIs below in volume v3 types client don't describe their
actual functions clearly or fully. This patch deprecates the original
names of these APIs and renames them to the new ones.

1. show_volume_type_extra_specs -> show_volume_type_extra_specs_item
2. create_volume_type_extra_specs -> create_or_update_volume_type_extra_specs
3. delete_volume_type_extra_specs -> delete_volume_type_extra_specs_item
4. update_volume_type_extra_specs -> update_volume_type_extra_specs_item

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names
Change-Id: I4e93d3c71ce4030960ac470d94fc5f4c6bef0eed
"}]
commit_message:
Rename volume type extra specs APIs

The name of APIs below in volume v3 types client don't describe their
actual functions clearly or fully. This patch deprecates the original
names of these APIs and renames them to the new ones.

1. show_volume_type_extra_specs -> show_volume_type_extra_specs_item
2. create_volume_type_extra_specs -> create_or_update_volume_type_extra_specs
3. delete_volume_type_extra_specs -> delete_volume_type_extra_specs_item
4. update_volume_type_extra_specs -> update_volume_type_extra_specs_item

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names
Change-Id: I4e93d3c71ce4030960ac470d94fc5f4c6bef0eed

commit_message:
Add method to wrap HashiCorp Vault HTTP API calls.

The new method handles the HTTP request for the Vault HTTP API
and does the error checking in a single place. The same code
was already in four different places in the same file.

Change-Id: I4b688d8cf994fb26f88570840523fcc0ac24faba
Signed-off-by: Moises Guimaraes de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

subject: import zuul job settings from project-config
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-20 02:22:33.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/project.yaml'], 'message': 'import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ia4a56b77fa526d46d521517ee4e13ce12dae6f4d
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319
'}]
commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ia4a56b77fa526d46d521517ee4e13ce12dae6f4d
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

"Rocky" matches this now, so we can drop the compatibility code.

Change-Id: I92d59d10de4df1776b5b80f9f7db8be9331e4b1f

commit_message:
libvirt: Drop MIN_LIBVIRT_VHOSTUSER_MQ

The updated minimum required libvirt (1.3.1) and QEMU (2.5.0) for
"Rocky" matches this now, so we can drop the compatibility code.

Also remove / fix relevant unit tests.

Change-Id: I92d59d10de4df1776b5b80f9f7db8be9331e4b1f

subject: Clean up unused VNF status
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-13 07:43:23.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/plugins/common/constants.py', 'tacker/db/vnfm/vnfm_db.py'], 'message': 'Clean up unused VNF status

Currently, "DOWN" and "INACTIVE" are defined as VNF status, but these

commit_message:
Clean up unused VNF status

Currently, "DOWN" and "INACTIVE" are defined as VNF status, but these
status is no need to be used anymore. So this patch aim to remove
these status from Tacker code.

Change-Id: I98a4f24b8ddb4de5bd799de243cf728cac99e615

subject: Backout actions.yaml as a tactical fix.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-09-20 07:00:43.000000000', 'files': ['actions.yaml'], 'message': 'Backout actions.yaml as a tactical fix.

The current implementation forces a charm to define its own
pause/resume actions and charm lint will fail if they do not. This
breaks charms in an unpleasant way so instead work is ongoing
to make pause/resume code standalone in this layer. For the moment
backout actions to unbreak charms.

Change-Id: I04f313097f632d7fa89e1734b966d12bda21656c
'}]
commit_message:
Backout actions.yaml as a tactical fix.

The current implementation forces a charm to define its own
pause/resume actions and charm lint will fail if they do not. This
breaks charms in an unpleasant way so instead work is ongoing
to make pause/resume code standalone in this layer. For the moment
backout actions to unbreak charms.

Change-Id: I04f313097f632d7fa89e1734b966d12bda21656c

subject: Pin fog-openstack to < 0.3.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-20 04:42:22.000000000', 'files': ['metadata.rb'], 'message': "Pin fog-openstack to < 0.3.0

With 0.3.1, fog-openstack renames much of its API, resulting in
errors such as:

  openstack_domain[default] (openstack-identity::registration line 69) had
  an error: NameError: uninitialized constant Fog::Identity::OpenStack

Let's stay below 0.3 for now.

Change-Id: Id3e9e6d8560ef5ffd9d28eedc0a2494722a2878f
(cherry picked from commit 0664bf29358ce16d85756d994751b4a3a37a6118)
"}]
commit_message:
Pin fog-openstack to < 0.3.0

With 0.3.1, fog-openstack renames much of its API, resulting in
errors such as:

  openstack_domain[default] (openstack-identity::registration line 69) had
  an error: NameError: uninitialized constant Fog::Identity::OpenStack

Let's stay below 0.3 for now.

Change-Id: Id3e9e6d8560ef5ffd9d28eedc0a2494722a2878f
(cherry picked from commit 0664bf29358ce16d85756d994751b4a3a37a6118)

Fix port_range_max attribute definition

port_range_max in an ICMP security group rule defines the
ICMP code value, fix a copy/paste typo.

Closes-bug: #1793285

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I824142c7797b490fa29dcae4b4e97e374d109ed5
Story: #2002586
Task: #24312

commit_message:
Fix delorean-deps url for releases >= rocky

Since Rocky, RDO has split dependencies repo in two different
repos, one for runtime requirement with the URL used in previous
releases and a new one with the packages that are only required
to build packages.
This patch fixes repos to the correct set for rocky and master
in the releases file which have these wrongly set.

Change-Id: I94621e899c1e854d8a762cb05b495b8fd9178ef7

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: Ic8a137794ac0805a4e5890bda9eb2740f2bf9d76
Partial-Bug: #1712399

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I936827b7b18e5c83717b7bffbed53a8e71d9a2bf
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

As of horizon 14.0.0.0b2 or later the use_mox directive is unecessary so we can remove it.

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

Remove bundled intree tempest plugin

  monasca_log_api tempest plugin to monasca tempest plugin

Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-09-20 02:14:09.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I33a23c7721a91d217425ef4da7a0760d0b45e80e
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I33a23c7721a91d217425ef4da7a0760d0b45e80e

commit_message:
Add non-containerized Python 3.6 gate

Patch also changes the way we run kuryr-controller in the DevStack
plugin by removing the scripts/run_server.py and using the Python
executable in the system directly.

Implements: blueprint goal-python36

Change-Id: I1e1c62023b6018bf49163be12fdca5b42d5f46d6

commit_message:
Remove mysql-python

The mysql-python package is no longer maintained. We are using
pymysql instead, so this package does not need to be installed.

Change-Id: I194cea7b270702206b7c3661523804e351798e81
(cherry picked from commit 0739e621623fd5a861d17dce883792202501d8bc)
